Title: How to prove that $\lim \frac{1}{n} \sqrt[n]{(n+1)(n+2)... 2n} = \frac{4}{e}$
Content: I'd like a hint to show that: $$\lim _{n\to\infty}\frac{1}{n} \sqrt[n]{(n+1)(n+2) \cdots 2n} = \frac{4}{e} .$$ Thanks.
AcceptedAnswer: You could rewrite it as $$4\left(\frac{\sqrt[2n]{(2n)!}}{2n}\right)^2\cdot\frac{n}{\sqrt[n]{n!}}$$ and use the result of this question .
